00089 
00090   /*
00091    * %Hyperspace session.  Provides the API for %Hyperspace, a namespace and
00092    * lock service.  This service is modeled after
00093    * <a href="http://labs.google.com/papers/chubby.html">Chubby</a>.
00094    * Presently it is implemented as just a single server, but ultimately
00095    * it will get re-written using a distributed consensus protocol for high
00096    * availablility.  For now, it provides the same functionality (albeit less
00097    * available) and the same API.
00098    * This allows us to get the system up and running and since the API is the
00099    * same as the API for the highly-available version, minimal code changes
00100    * will be needed when we swap out this one for the highly available one.
00101    * <p>
00102    * %Session establishes a session with the master which includes a TCP
00103    * connection and the initiation of regular heartbeat UDP messages.  As soon
00104    * as the master receives the first heartbeat message from the client
00105    * %Session object, it creates the session and grants a lease. Each heartbeat
00106    * that the master receives from the client causes the master to extend the
00107    * lease.  In this mode of operation, the session is in the SAFE state.  If
00108    * the master does not receive a heartbeat message before the lease
00109    * expiration time, then the session transitions to the EXPIRED state and
00110    * the master drops the session.
00111    * <p>
00112    * Whenever the client receives a heartbeat UDP response message, it advances
00113    * its conservative estimate of what it thinks the lease expiration time is.
00114    * If the lease expires, then the client will put the session in the JEOPARDY
00115    * state and will continue sending heartbeats for a period of time known as
00116    * the 'grace period'. During the JEOPARDY state, all %Hyperspace commands
00117    * are suspended.  If a heartbeat response message is received during the
00118    * grace period, then it will switch back to SAFE mode and allow pending
00119    * commands to proceed.  Otherwise, the session expires.
00120    * <p>
00121    * The following set of properties are available to configure the protocol
00122    * (default values are shown):
00123    * <pre>
00124    * Hyperspace.Lease.Interval=2000
00125    * Hyperspace.KeepAlive.Interval=1000
00126    * Hyperspace.GracePeriod=6000
00127    * </pre>
00128    */
00129   class Session : public ReferenceCount {
00130 
00131   public:
00132 
00136     enum State {
00138       STATE_EXPIRED,
00140       STATE_JEOPARDY,
00142       STATE_SAFE
00143     };

00412     void advance_expire_time(boost::xtime now) {
00413       ScopedLock lock(m_mutex);
00414       m_expire_time = now;
00415       xtime_add_millis(m_expire_time, m_lease_interval);
00416     }
